intro: Baileya nervosa, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its stems and leaves are covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss and protect against intense sunlight. Baileya nervosa is often found in rocky soils and is considered a hardy, resilient species in its native habitat.
